Practica1

Interface Tree<E>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Position<E>>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LCRSTree, LCRSTreePlus, LinkedTree, LinkedTreePlus

    public interface Tree<E>
extends java.lang.Iterable<Position<E>>
    An interface for a tree where nodes can have an arbitrary number of children.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Iterable<? extends Position<E>> children(Position<E> v)
      Returns an iterable collection of the children of a given node.
      boolean isEmpty()
      Returns whether the tree is empty.
      boolean isInternal(Position<E> v)
      Returns whether a given node is internal.
      boolean isLeaf(Position<E> v)
      Returns whether a given node is external.
      boolean isRoot(Position<E> v)
      Returns whether a given node is the root of the tree.
      Position<E> parent(Position<E> v)
      Returns the parent of a given node.
      Position<E> root()
      Returns the root of the tree.
      int size()
      Returns the number of nodes in the tree.

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Iterable

        forEach, iterator, spliterator
